;

;County subsidence is one of the core issues in the field of basic education in recent times. For example, Professor Lin Xiaoying of Peking University's "Children in the County—— The book "China's County Education Ecology" paints this picture: College entrance examination scores have seriously declined, high-quality students have disappeared, and the teaching team is aging... Counties that were once an important link in the upward mobility channel for children from poor families have been unable to perform as expected. As a result, the desolation of education in the county has become a spreading reality, and the county is like a hometown that has bid farewell, becoming a relic of the new urban middle class who have completed individual urbanization.

;

;I am ashamed to say that during the years when I devoted myself to serving basic education schools, I visited some counties, but I was not aware of the sharp social issue of "county collapse". problem, but not much in-depth understanding. For example, a certain county in Shandong Province that I once served relied on its rising admission rate and even continued to export students from Qingbei, challenging the "big boss" in the region and province year after year. Not only is it not a "collapse", but on the contrary, it has soared in the local basic education rankings - often real estate self-media or parents' actual word-of-mouth. It is eventually called a "counterattack" by the education industry media and is considered to have achieved A perfect transformation from a county high school located in the suburbs to a "modern school well-known in Qilu and going nationwide."

;

;You can even read comments like this on social media, talking about an interesting phenomenon in Shandong: enterprising children from urban families often try their best to The solution is to go back and study in the county. Campus life is very rich. "It is not a college entrance examination factory. There are many sports teams, cultural festivals, and art societies, and it has also cultivated many competition experts."

;

;Of course, as mentioned in the comments, those who try their best to return to the county may not necessarily be "enterprising children", but more likely to be "enterprising children". Enterprising parents.”

;

;The factors of the general environment are well known: social urbanization drives educational urbanization, and due to the innate Confucian emphasis on education genes in the East Asian cultural circle, once educational urbanization begins, Its speed must be much ahead of social urbanization. So we see this phenomenon: children from rural areas enter the county, and children from the county town enter the city. The county town between the countryside and the city, among the counties that have created a large number of miracles after the reform and opening up, has lost its aura in the new historical changes. Furthermore, the pivotal value of urban-rural conversion and class crossing has gradually been lost. The process of this underlying logic manifesting itself in reality is reflected in the collapse of the county.

;

;;

;

;"Children in the County", written by Lin Xiaoying, Shanghai People's Publishing House , July 2023.

;

;However, in this process of urbanization transformation, there will also be a phenomenon of "counter-urbanization" that rises against the trend: some former counties Expanded into a super school. The former county school mentioned earlier has also emerged as an educational group that can challenge the provincial government and has several branch schools, covering both public and private systems. In fact, the counties that I have visited and served often have the following two characteristics: balanced distance and extreme county mode. The so-called equilibrium distance means that these rising counties are often not far or close to the central city of the central city, or they themselves were once suburban counties of the central city and later became the suburbs of the city. The Ultimate County High School model refers to taking the model from the glory days of the early County High School to the extreme: after competing for high-quality students, using extreme exam-oriented methods, suppressing one's nature and gaining the psychological motivation to live toward death in order to succeed in the college entrance examination. But this psychological dynamic is often accompanied by strong feelings of resentment.

;

;This is why some students from super middle schools think of themselves as typical examples of children from poor families. Even though urbanization transformation has been achieved, the ideology of these schools still remains at the county level. Through the confrontation between urban and rural areas, the bottom class and the elite, they have obtained the rationality and motivational support resources to inherit and complete the county education model. . I still remember the famous saying of a student from Hengshui Middle School: "I am just a native pig from the countryside, but I am determined to conquer the cabbage in the big city."

;

;But this classmate, who regarded himself as a local pig, was picked up by his father in an Audi private car during the vacation. In those "rising counties", there is also a question mark as to how many children are from the counties.

;

;The rising counties started with extremely exam-oriented education. After completing primitive accumulation, they began to enter a more diversified development. Even in the face of the new college entrance examination reform, the resources and capital they have are enough to cope with this change. They can even use this as an opportunity to achieve secondary development and complete the complete transformation from rural civilization to urban civilization - the transformation is completed. The sign may be that in the future, on social platforms such as Zhihu, graduates from these schools will no longer lament that after reaching university, there is still a gap between them and students who graduated from the real cities such as Xingshi.

;

;However, behind the rise of super-secondary counties is often the decline of one century-old county after another. This is the real dilemma of county education. Wang Xinfeng, from the China Education Policy Research Institute at Beijing Normal University, pointed out in the keynote report "County Dilemmas from the Perspective of Access to Higher Education Opportunities" that at present, high-quality students, teachers and other educational resources are gradually gathering in central cities, and the gap in high school education resources continues to widen. , in some areas, the decline in the quality of higher education in counties has become an inevitable trend. This will not only have an impact on the county's education ecology and social governance pattern, but also explicitly and implicitly exclude access to higher education opportunities.

;

;Many of the expectations given to the county today are related to our social development stage: after entering the 1980s, the start of China's urbanization process provided the county with brilliant opportunities possible, but this brilliance diminished with the arrival of the next stage of development.

;

;We might as well extend the timeline longer. Andrew Byron Kipnis, professor of the Department of Anthropology at the Chinese University of Hong Kong, in his book "Desire for Governance Education" describes Zouping, Shandong: Like other places in China, Zouping experienced shocking political ruptures in the 20th century. The end of the Qing Dynasty, the beginning of the Republic of China, the Japanese invasion, and the civil war between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party. Amidst all the ruptures, education showed the continued development of On the one hand, basic education has developed steadily - eliminating illiteracy, first by universalizing six years of primary education, and later by nine years of compulsory education. Although education developed most rapidly in the 1950s and 1970s, education also improved as early as the early 1930s during the rural construction movement promoted by Liang Shuming and others in Zouping. The institutional foundation for the popularization of education was laid even as early as the Republic of China. Finally, after more than half a century of continuous efforts, in January 1995, Zouping achieved two basic goals: nine-year compulsory education, and the elimination of illiteracy among the population under the age of 45.

;

;So, in the current discussion of the collapse of many counties, what does it mean to revitalize the county? Is it going back to the peak of the county in the 1980s and 1990s, or even earlier, to become a high point where the cultural context of the place condenses?

;

;In fact, the real problem in the revitalization of the county is not the county itself, but more importantly, the importance of the county's social ecology and educational ecology in the process of historical change. Shape and coordinate. At the same time, as an important part of social governance, how to achieve good governance in education under a deterministic new value scale is probably the real issue in the revitalization of the county. Specifically, this kind of "good governance", as summarized by Wang Xinfeng, firstly requires adhering to the system concept, clarifying the characteristics of the social development stage, and re-examining county development issues under the strategic goals of common prosperity and new urbanization; secondly, it must improve education Allocate resources, strengthen comprehensive management of education, and ensure a fair starting point for county middle school students to obtain higher education opportunities on the basis of high-quality development; third, continue to deepen the reform of the examination and enrollment system, expand the implementation scope of special plans, and ensure that county middle school students have higher education in the college admissions process. Equity in educational opportunities and outcomes.

;

;;The author used to be a college teacher and is now a basic education service practitioner;

;Last year, AMC’s animated science fiction drama "Yiban.io" "Temple" detonated the entire Internet, and it still has a super high score of 8.8 on Douban, and even 100% unanimous praise on the Rotten Tomatoes website.

;

;Just when the majority of drama fans were eagerly awaiting the second season, the show was not well-received and had poor ratings. AMC, which was already financially weak, decided to cancel the sequel. Fortunately, Amazon took over and injected funds to continue the production of the second season, allowing "Pantheon" to be fully concluded.

;

;Now that the second season is online, it is immediately popular, with an opening score of 9.3, making it the strongest animated show this year.

;

;;

;

;In the Before analyzing the second season, let us first review the science fiction setting and story background of the first season.

;

;The core concept of "Pantheon" is "upload intelligence", referred to as "UI". The technology company in the play uploads signal data to the network through precise scanning of neurons in the human brain to generate upload intelligence.

;

;Different from AI tools such as "ChatGPT" that we are familiar with, to a certain extent, uploaded intelligence can be regarded as a brand new life form, but it gets rid of the physical body and travels in the online world with pure consciousness.

;

;;

;

;Season 1 In it, David, the father of the heroine Mandy, uploaded his neuron signals to the Internet before his death, becoming the earliest uploaded intelligence.

;

;In addition, Indian engineer Chanda and genius girl Laurie have become uploading intelligence. However, their positions are completely opposite. Chanda wants to expand the world of uploaded intelligence in an extreme way; Laurie is a defender of the real world and wants to join forces with David to resist Chanda's conspiracy.

;

;;

;

;Season 1 In the end, David sacrificed himself to preserve human society, but what followed was a global disconnection, and governments around the world were afraid of the unlimited capabilities of uploaded intelligence. Not only that, due to the "integrity defect", the uploaded intelligence itself is also very unstable, and may completely die as its energy continues to decay.

;

;The key to solving the problem falls on the hero Caspian. This is a cloned boy who grew up in design just like Truman in "The Truman Show". Caspian's identity is Steve, the founder of the technology giant company "Algorithm Beat".

;

;;

;

;So, no. At the beginning of the second season, two major conflicts emerged. One is that public protests continue, and they believe that the crisis caused by Upload Smart is just a cover, demanding that the government immediately restore the network; the other is that the government still intends to use Upload Smart for its own use, but must address its own shortcomings.

;

;Since then, the “safe browsing” software launched by the government has become a prerequisite for people to access the Internet. To put it bluntly, this is an anti-virus software that specifically hunts upload intelligence; as for Caspian, with the help of Mandy, he solved the core problem of "integrity defect" and made the upload intelligence truly immortal.

;

;;

;

;If, The focus of the first season of "Pantheon" was on uploading intelligence's confusion about self-identity and the complex situation of ethical relationships. In the second season, the depth of thinking and critical consciousness displayed in the series are much broader and deeper. .

;

;The first is the issue of "integrity defects".

;

;As early as more than ten years ago, the extremely smart Steve had actually understood everything about uploading intelligence, and even ordered his subordinates to freeze and seal his brain, starting a cloning project, with the purpose of cultivating intelligence. Caspian, let him solve the problem that he can't do anything about.

;

;;

;

;Due to history Tiff has the same brain circuit, so Caspian cannot easily break through the mental prison. The most interesting thing about the episode is that it uses Mandy's words to inspire Caspian.

;

;In Mandy's view, "others" are the reason why we are where we are today as a human species, and the reason why we live and die.

;

;To put it more simply, we do not live for ourselves, but become uneven and colorful because of external driving forces. The richness of human nature does not depend on one's own cultivation and growth, but on the instantaneous changes around us.

;

;;

;

;So, when When Caspian analyzed David's raw data, he realized that concern for his daughter constituted a necessary factor for David to be a complete soul.

;

;This is actually similar to the setting of the first season. The reason why David, Chanda and Laurie, unlike other experimenters, have self-awareness is because they came into contact with their family and loved ones. . Emotion bridges the shortcomings of reason.

;

;;

;

;Another character in the play A setting worth chewing is Mandy’s “sister” Misty.

;

;The fog is neither AI (artificial intelligence) nor UI (upload intelligence), but CI (cloud intelligence). It sounds a bit convoluted, but it's actually not difficult to understand. AI is an intelligent agent created by humans; UI is the life form of human consciousness; and CI is a new existence that UI reproduces in the online world.

;

;The reason why Misty claims to be Mandy's sister is because she was automatically generated from David and Laurie's data.

;

;;

;

;Mandy knows After this situation, it is difficult to accept. After all, does mist count as a living thing? It is difficult to define. Even if it is regarded as a living body, if a stranger suddenly comes to Mandy and recognizes her, how should the latter treat it?

;

;This kind of imaginative ethical setting has almost never appeared in previous film and television works. It not only explores the essence of life, but also asks: Does family ties originate from blood relatives, or does it rely on memory and emotion?

;

;"Pantheon" does not deal with this topic perfunctorily, but tells us the mixed feelings in family relationships through the fierce conflict between Mandy and Misty.

;

;;

;

;When Mandy When she placed all her hopes on Misty, hoping that she could defeat Steve, the latter used a set of logical and rigorous arguments to convince Misty. Mandy was very angry about this, and even yelled out that Misty was not her sister at all.

;

;The fact that Miwu left angrily and even ignored Mandy in anger for a long time proved her "humanity" from the side.

;

;The difference is that human beings will feel sad because of the past, but because Misty has no past, she will only feel lonely and lonely about the future. This kind of psychological detail with great speculative significance may be the reason why the drama "Pantheon" often makes our souls tremble and make us realize something.

;

;;

;

;If, The content and themes of the first six episodes are still at the level of binary opposition, that is, the game between the "human faction" represented by Mandy and Caspian, and the "upload intelligence faction" represented by Steve, then The last two episodes completely exceeded the psychological expectations of fans of the drama, crossing over to bold assumptions about the future world in sociology, politics, psychology and other levels.

;

;Although Steve was defeated, the technology of uploading intelligence has not stopped. Just twenty years after Caspian and Steve "died together", a total of four billion people around the world were uploaded from real society to cyberspace.

;

;Most of the reasons why people choose this path are not forced by impending death, but the inevitable result of the rapid increase in productivity and the subsequent changes in production relations.

;

;;

;

;Upload smart user The least time cost, the most work tasks can be completed, so in the real society, "the living people are gradually being robbed of their jobs by the dead." When death becomes immortality, and freedom and wealth become available without any effort, human beings will no longer pity the physical body but yearn for the virtual.

;

;Of course, this relationship is fluid. When we follow Caspian's perspective and quickly understand the changes in the past two decades, we will find that no matter what time it is, hostility, war, and ideological division will always exist.

;

;The second season of "Pantheon", like a science fiction accelerator with continuous brainstorming, takes us to imagine the "earth past" that is very likely to happen in the future, and allows love and family relationships to develop over decades and on. In the long span of hundreds to hundreds of thousands of years, incredible flavors are fermented.

;

;;

;

;In reality , a piece of profound data shows that as of January 2021, more than 500 people around the world have been cryogenically sealed, and more than 3,000 wealthy people have registered for cryogenic projects.

;

;Will this group of people, like the uploaded intelligence in "Pantheon", become the first batch of "network immigrants" in the metaverse in the future? Perhaps the distance between reality and the world of science fiction has long exceeded our imagination.

;Recently, the "China Obesity Map" was released.

;

;This is the largest study to date on the prevalence of overweight and obesity and related complications in China. According to the BMI classification standard for obesity in my country, the proportion of obese people is 13.7%. The top five provinces with obesity in the country are: Hebei (21.9%), Inner Mongolia (19.8%), Shandong (19.7%), Tianjin (19.6%), Liaoning ( 18.2%). Compared with northern provinces and cities, the obesity rate in southern provinces is lower.

;

;Where does the obesity difference between North and South come from? The "Dietary Guidelines for Chinese Residents (2022)" defines the eating habits of Fujian, Guangdong and other regions as "Oriental healthy dietary patterns". This model has the characteristics of high food diversity, relatively light diet, sufficient intake of fresh vegetables and fruits, relatively high intake of fish and shrimp, low intake of pork, etc., and enhanced intake of milk and legumes. , resulting in a higher overall meal quality compliance rate.

;

;Compared with the lighter eating habits in the south, northern cuisine is more flavorful and pays attention to both color, flavor and flavor.

;

;Of course, the increase in obesity rate is not only caused by "eating". From the perspective of scientific research: obesity is determined by system dynamics factors and environmental determinants. This push is amplified or moderated by individual-level genetic susceptibility, psychosocial factors, obesogens and adverse early life exposures and other coexisting underlying risk factors, through unhealthy diet and lack of physical activity.

;

;While paying attention to obesity, the topic #weightloss# often also attracts much attention. For example, on Douyin, Xiaohongshu, Weibo and other platforms, there are Videos and notes on the topic #weightloss# have been read more than 10 million times. Not only that, but various weight loss tools are also emerging in endlessly.

;

;Obesity is also a "fulcrum" that drives various diseases. The World Health Organization report believes that overweight and obesity are important causes of high blood pressure. Among endocrine and metabolic diseases, the diabetes rate among overweight people is as high as 20.4%, which is 4 to 5 times higher than that among people with normal weight. Modern research has also proven that obese people are often accompanied by hyperinsulinemia, which may be the root cause of cancer.

;

;Healthy and scientific weight loss and exercise are very important. For your own health, "Know" tells you how to say "goodbye" to excess fat correctly.

;On November 8 and November 10, 2023, the Shanghai and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges issued a number of self-regulatory guidelines. Visual China/Photo

;

;The well-known investment institution Hillhouse Capital staged "disappearing shares" in A-shares, citing the China Securities Regulatory Commission to initiate an investigation.

;

;On November 8, 2023, LONGi Green Energy (601012.SH) announced that it was suspected of violating restrictive regulations by transferring LONGi Green Energy shares. In accordance with the Penalty Law and other laws and regulations, the China Securities Regulatory Commission decided to file a case against HHLR Management Co., Ltd., a shareholder of Longi Green Energy.

;

;HHLR Management Co., Ltd.-China Value Fund (hereinafter referred to as HHLR) is an investment management company under Hillhouse Capital focusing on the secondary market. It was formerly known as Hillhouse Capital Management Co., Ltd.-China Value Fund Trading (hereinafter referred to as Hillhouse Asset Management).

;

;In March, HHLR, the major shareholder holding 5.85% of Longi Green Energy, lent 1% of its shares through two refinancings. However, after the maturity and return, HHLR’s shareholding dropped by 0.87% compared with before the loan. gap. The market suspects that HHLR reduced its holdings during the refinancing period.

;

;In fact, not only HHLR, but also many shareholders of listed companies have quietly reduced their shareholdings to less than 5% after refinancing. It’s just that Hillhouse Capital, as a star investment institution, has attracted a lot of attention.

;

;Regulatory response was rapid. On November 8 and 10, the Shanghai and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges issued a number of self-regulatory guidelines aimed at patching the above vulnerabilities.

;

;"Disappeared Shares"

;

;HHLR's shares were originally transferred from LONGi Green Energy's major shareholders.

;

;On December 19, 2020, Li Chunan, the major shareholder of Longi Green Energy, transferred 6% of his shares to Hillhouse Asset Management at a price of 70 yuan per share. The total transaction consideration was approximately 15.84 billion yuan. . Li Chunan is the concerted person acting in concert with the actual controllers of LONGi Co., Ltd. Li Zhenguo and Li Xiyan.

;

;According to the alumni news of Lanzhou University, LONGi Green Energy was co-founded by three classmates from the physics department of Lanzhou University in 1986 - Li Zhenguo, Zhong Baoshen, and Li Chunan. It was named after the old president Jiang Longji.

;

;On the first trading day after the transfer announcement, LONGi Green Energy opened sharply and closed at the daily limit. Subsequently, LONGi redeemed its convertible bonds, the total share capital increased, and Hillhouse Asset Management's shareholding was diluted to 5.85%.

;

;On March 21, 2023, Longi Green Energy issued the "Informative Announcement Regarding Shareholders' Participation in the Refinancing Securities Lending Business and Equity Changes", stating that the renamed Hillhouse Asset Management, or HHLR, participated in the refinancing. Rongtong Securities Lending Business lends 0.85% of its shares with a term of 182 days. It plans to continue lending no more than 0.15% of its shares in the next 90 days.

;

;Margin financing is when investors ask brokers to borrow money to buy stocks or borrow stocks to sell. However, brokers’ own funds and securities sources are limited, so refinancing has emerged, including refinancing and refinancing. Vouchers.

;

;The refinancing business in mainland China began in 2013. China Securities Finance Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as CSI Financial), as the counterparty to securities lending transactions, is the only domestic financial institution engaged in refinancing business. Its shareholders include the Shanghai and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges.

;

;Among them, refinancing business means that CSI Financial lends its own funds or funds raised through the issuance of bonds to securities companies, and then the securities companies lend it to customers for them to buy and list. Company stock.

;

;Securities refinancing business means that CSI Financial borrows securities from "lenders" such as shareholders of listed companies, and then refinances them to securities companies, which provide them to customers for sale.

;

;For example, in the securities refinancing business that Hillhouse Asset Management participates in, CSI Financial first borrows circulating securities from the shareholders of Longi Green Energy.

;

;Longi Green Energy did not disclose the specific time for lending 0.15% of HHLR shares. However, its first quarter report for 2023 shows that HHLR’s shareholding has dropped to 4.85%, which means that HHLR participated in two refinancings within 10 days at the end of March.

;

;It was also not disclosed when the shares loaned by HHLR will expire. Based on the time of its participation in refinancing and the 182-day lending period, it can be inferred that the 1% of shares lent by HHLR should be returned no later than September 30.

;

;However, LONGi Green Energy’s third quarter report for 2023 shows that HHLR’s shareholding is only 4.98%, which is 0.87% lower than the 5.89% shareholding before participating in refinancing. HHLR also did not disclose the reasons why its holdings decreased during the period when the shares were loaned.

;

;According to the "Measures for the Administration of Disclosure of Listed Companies" and other relevant regulations, when shareholders holding more than 5% of the shares change, they should proactively inform the board of directors of the listed company and cooperate with the listed company in fulfilling its information disclosure obligations.

;

;However, LONGi Green Energy stated in the relevant announcement of HHLR refinancing in March that the shares were not registered under the name of the information disclosure obligor (HHLR) during the loan period, and “after the completion of this equity change, information disclosure The obligor shall no longer be a shareholder holding more than 5% of the shares of the listed company."

;

;The market generally believes that HHLR has circumvented the letter disclosure requirements for shareholders holding more than 5% of the shares through refinancing, thus achieving a "detour reduction". Based on LONGi Green Energy’s current stock price of 23 yuan per share, HHLR has a floating loss of approximately 5.6 billion yuan compared with the time of purchase.

;

;Southern Weekend reporter sent an interview letter to Hillhouse’s official email, asking whether he had reduced his shareholding during the refinancing period, and under which regulations he was determined to no longer hold more than 5% of the shares of Longi Green Energy. Shareholders have not received a reply as of press time.

;

;Not an isolated case

;

;For a long time, the securities lending business developed slowly.

;

;The report of the Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation and Research Center shows that as of April 30, 2020, the balance of margin financing and securities lending was 1.0431 billion yuan, accounting for 2.16% of the circulating market value of A-shares, of which the financing balance was 1.0216 billion yuan. Accounting for 97.9% of the total, insufficient securities sources are one of the main obstacles limiting the development of the securities lending market.

;

;In order to expand the source of securities, in 2019 and 2020, the Shanghai and Shenzhen Stock Exchanges successively included qualified institutional investors such as public funds, social security funds, and insurance funds, as well as strategic investors participating in the issuer’s initial public offering. Include lenders and participate in securities lending on the Science and Technology Innovation Board and GEM.

;

;In February 2023, the China Securities Regulatory Commission issued relevant systems for the full implementation of the registration system, and extended the optimization measures for refinancing securities on the Science and Technology Innovation Board and GEM to the main board, further liberalizing the refinancing business.

;

;Although there is no express provision, during the period of participation in refinancing, the relevant shares are generally not registered in the name of the lender.

;

;According to the official website of CSI Financial, the refinancing securities lending business does not constitute a substantive securities transfer. If equity distribution occurs during the securities lending period, CSI Financial will compensate the lender in accordance with the business rules. However, CSI Financial Finance does not provide lenders with compensation for voting rights. During the period of securities lending, the number of shares held in the shareholder register will temporarily change and will be restored after the securities lending expires and is withdrawn.

;

;Hillhouse is not an isolated case, this phenomenon frequently occurs in A-shares.

;

;On August 5, 2022, Huayi Brothers (300027.SZ) issued an announcement stating that Shenzhen Tencent Computer Systems Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Tencent Computer), a shareholder holding 7.942441% of the shares, reduced its holdings through block transactions. 1.942447%, and participated in refinancing lending of 0.999998%. After that, Tencent Computer's shareholding dropped to 4.999997%, "no longer a shareholder holding more than 5% of Huayi Brothers' shares."

;

;Huayi Brothers’ 2022 annual report shows that Tencent Computer’s shareholding has dropped to 1%.

;

;On November 11, 2022, Changliang Technology (300348.SZ) announced that the shareholder Shenzhen Tencent Information Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Tencent Information) reduced its holdings by 0.78670% through block transactions and transferred Rongtong lent the same share, and its shareholding dropped from 6.57339% to 4.99999%, "no longer a shareholder holding more than 5% of Changliang Technology."

;

;Changliang Technology’s first quarter report for 2023 shows that Tencent Information’s shareholding dropped to 1.14%.

;

;On April 17, 2023, Guomai Culture (301052.SZ) announced that Zhejiang Bona Film and Television Production Co., Ltd., which holds 6.8756% of the company’s shares, participated in the refinancing and lent 0.8755% of the shares, and passed Large trades reduced holdings by 1.0001%. After the equity change, Bona Film and Television holds 4.9999% of the shares and "is no longer a shareholder holding more than 5% of the company's shares."

;

;Guomai Culture’s 2023 interim report showed that Bona Film and Television’s shareholding was reduced to 4.15%, and by the third quarter report, it was reduced to 3.15%.

;

;On May 31, 2023, Yuncong Technology (688327.SH) announced that its shareholder Jiadu Technology (600728.SH), which holds 6.63157% of the shares, reduced its holdings by 0.81579% through block transactions. During the refinancing process, the same share was lent, which reduced its shareholding to 4.99999%, "no longer a shareholder holding more than 5% of the company's shares."

;

;Yuncong Technology’s third quarter report for 2023 shows that Jiadu Technology’s shareholding ratio has been reduced to 3%.

;

;Shareholders of the above four companies all "coincidentally" reduced their shareholdings below the 5% letter disclosure red line through refinancing, and then reduced their shareholdings without letter disclosure.

;

;“Just because there is a precedent does not mean it is right.” According to Wang Jiyue, a senior investment banker, supervision clearly requires shareholders to reduce their holdings of more than 5%, and Hillhouse’s approach took advantage of loopholes in the rules.

;

;Emergency patching

;

;“Special treatment can be given to the disclosure rules of equity changes and shareholding reductions involved in securities lending.” Peng Bing, professor of Peking University Law School and securities law expert, told the South A reporter over the weekend explained that lending shares cannot be regarded as a true reduction of holdings because the lent shares will still be returned, so changes in equity should not be regarded as a reduction in equity and can be specifically disclosed as a temporary suspension.

;

;As soon as the words were spoken, supervision had already patched the loopholes in the rules.

;

;On November 8th and 10th, the Shanghai Stock Exchange, Shenzhen Stock Exchange, Science and Technology Innovation Board and GEM all updated self-regulatory guidelines, mainly revising the information disclosure content of relevant entities participating in refinancing business.

;

;Take the Shanghai Stock Exchange as an example. It issued the "Shanghai Stock Exchange Self-Regulatory Guidelines for Listed Companies No. 2 - Business Processing (Revised in November 2023)", which requires shareholders holding more than 5% of the shares to Clear requirements.

;

;According to the guidelines, when investors and their concerted parties participate in margin trading, securities lending and refinancing business, the number of shares of the same listed company held by their ordinary securities accounts and customer credit securities accounts shall be the same as the number of shares that have not been lent through refinancing. If the total number of shares of the company returned exceeds 5% of the company's total share capital, the reduction of the company's shares shall be subject to the Exchange's "Detailed Implementation Rules for Share Reductions by Shareholders and Directors, Supervisors and Senior Management Personnel of Listed Companies" and other rules regarding major shareholders. Regulations on reduction of holdings.

;

;This means that the number of shares lent by investors through refinancing should also be included in the number of shares when investors reduce their holdings, fundamentally eliminating "detour reduction". At the same time, the revised rules also prohibit relevant shareholders from participating in short-term trading.

;

;The above guidelines show that shareholders who hold more than 5% of the shares of a listed company, do not directly or indirectly increase or decrease the number of shares they hold, and only participate in the refinancing business to lend and withdraw securities within 6 months, shall not Relevant regulations on short-term trading apply. If the company's shareholding is less than 5% of the total share capital due to participation in refinancing and lending shares, the relevant regulations on short-term trading shall apply to the purchase and sale of stocks and other equity securities during the lending period.

;

;Article 44 of the Securities Law stipulates that if specific entities such as major shareholders, directors, supervisors and senior management of listed companies and companies listed on the New OTC Market engage in short-term trading activities, the proceeds shall belong to the company.

;

;According to the above guidelines, the specific situation of shareholders holding 5% of the shares participating in the financing and refinancing business during the reporting period must also be disclosed in the regular report on share changes and shareholder status.

; < p>;The specific information includes the name of the shareholder, the number and proportion of shares held at the beginning of the reporting period, the number and proportion of shares lent through refinancing at the beginning of the reporting period, the number and proportion of shares held at the end of the reporting period, the number and proportion of shares lent through refinancing at the end of the reporting period, etc.

;

;;What happens when an archaeologist becomes a "foodie"? Zhang Liangren, professor of history at Nanjing University, gave an example. ;

;

;;A meal of soup dumplings in a roadside fly shop can reveal 7,000 years of history: from the pottery age and the Bronze Age kitchen utensils "retort", From the ancient "steamer" on the kitchen murals of the Eastern Han Dynasty tombs in Henan, to the plum blossom buns in the caves of the Song Dynasty...;

;

;;A bowl of small wontons can help him interpret the weather of the universe. : ""The Chronicles of Yanjing" says: The shape of husband's wonton is like a chicken egg, which is quite similar to the chaos of heaven and earth, so it occurs during the winter solstice solar eclipse.";

;

;;

;

;;Dumplings from the Tang Dynasty;

;

;;Eating hot pot today? Then it's time to show real technology - "tell the history of whatever you see". The professor is not afraid. There was originally a legend of "fried Qin Hui" behind fried dough sticks, and tofu was called "Plough Qi" in Lu You's poem; "Compendium of Materia Medica" not only made Liu Genghong famous, but also recorded the method of making yuba; instant noodles are not a patent of the Japanese , but was "invented" by Yi Bingzhuo, a calligrapher from the Qing Dynasty in my country, who accidentally poured noodles into the oil pan at his mother's birthday party...;

;

;; The temptation of delicious food hangs on the taste buds, and these historical knowledge and anecdotes remain in the audience's memory through Zhang Liangren's eloquent narration. ;

;

;;

;

;;Netizens commented that Zhang Liangren looks like the Chinese version of a lonely gourmet;

;

;; With this "unique skill", Zhang Liangren gained 38,000 fans and 300,000 likes in just over two months after joining Douyin. He was called "The Lonely Gourmet" that is more suitable for Chinese babies' physiques. This expressed the wish he expressed in the first video: "Break the dimensional wall, take off the cold and mysterious mask of archeology, and let everyone see the lovely and warm inner nature of this subject.";

;

;;What people don’t know is that this archaeologist decided to become a food blogger because he could “dig in the soil” happily. ;

;

;;;1. An archaeologist who only loves food;;

;

;;Graduated from Peking University undergraduate and social studies A postgraduate student of the Academy of Science and Technology went to the University of California, Los Angeles to get a doctorate. He worked as a researcher for many years and later became a professor at Nanjing University. Zhang Liangren devoted his life to archeology: "he can go to the field and write articles." He not only does Chinese archeology, Also doing world archeology. In his own words: "The total number of countries he has visited and explored could circle the earth.";

;

;;It is also Zhang Liangren's habit to eat wherever he goes. Iranian mutton stew and saffron rice, Russian kebabs, and Siberian grilled fish... all impressed him. ;

;

;;

;

;;Zhang Liangren visited Tajikistan in 2011;

;

;;However, Zhang Liangren admitted frankly that he is far from being a qualified "foodie": he enjoys delicious food, but he has not yet reached the point of searching for delicious food. What really guided him to become a food blogger was his love for archeology. ;

;

;;Last year, Zhang Liangren accidentally opened a monograph "Diet in Chinese Culture" from the 1970s. The editor-in-chief of the book, Zhang Guangzhi, is a famous Chinese archaeologist, anthropologist, and Zhang Liangren’s mentor. The whole book provides a panoramic display and interpretation of China's food culture. From the pre-Qin Dynasty to the Han, Tang, Yuan, Ming and Qing dynasties, how did the characteristics of agricultural society affect the evolution of food on this land? How did Confucian moral concepts and social organization methods determine the Chinese people? cooking and dining habits...;

;

;;Zhang Liangren read more than 400 pages in one breath, as if he saw a new door: he has been doing archaeology for a lifetime, and he has been eating for a lifetime. , but never realized that there was such a close connection between the two. ;

;

;;From then on, eating was no longer just about eating. He could not help but think about it while eating: Why must there be food and rice on the Chinese dining table? "Dual diet", but Westerners are accustomed to "one plate"? What makes the Chinese form a shared meal system, while Westerners form a divided meal system? When were wheat and tomatoes introduced to China, and how did the stir-fry cooking method come about? ;

;

;;In fact, food archeology is not a brand-new research topic. It is only because food is perishable and cannot be preserved in the long history, and it is too difficult to excavate that it leads to There are very few people doing relevant research in the global archaeological community, and even fewer in China. But Zhang Liangren decided that he would face the difficulties. ;

;

;;Just do it. This year, Zhang Liangren recruited two students to specialize in dietary archeology, hoping to unearth more dietary cultural relics and fill the gaps in archaeological research. Zhang Liangren has always had an academic ideal: to let the world hear the voice of the Chinese archaeological community. "The first is to publish Chinese archeology abroad, and the second is to participate more in international archeology and contribute to world archeology.";

;

;;For this reason, he has Single-handedly initiated archaeological projects of Sino-Russian and Sino-Iranian cooperation. The Iranian team adopted the European excavation method, digging straight down like a deep well. Zhang Liangren felt that this area was too small and too inefficient, so he persuaded the other party to use the Chinese trench excavation method. The results were remarkable and were not only published in international journals. The paper attracted the attention of academic circles and was visited by members of the Iranian Congress. ;

;

;;How to make cold knowledge more pyrotechnic? Letting more people realize the value of archaeological history is something Zhang Liangren and his friends around him often discuss. In July this year, with the help of several friends, Zhang Liangren opened his own Douyin account and started to explore food stores. Zhang Liangren is responsible for the appearance, and friends are responsible for filming and production. ;

;

;;He made no secret that the reason why he came up with the idea of ​​making short videos was to spread knowledge to the public, and the other original intention was to "expand awareness" and let more people People know the value of archeology and support archaeological research in more ways. ;

;

;;;2. Pour some cold water on young people who want to study archeology;;

;

;;Zhang Liangren The video is full of the fireworks of life and has a sense of history. He picked up a mouthful of duck blood vermicelli soup and said that this vermicelli soup has only a few decades of history, but from a can of duck eggs unearthed from a mound tomb in Jurong, Jiangsu, it can be seen that the tradition of eating waterfowl in Jiangsu dates back to 2,500 years ago. It started years ago. ;

;

;;It is also interesting to examine the origin of imitation meat vegetarian food. Emperor Liang Wu of the Han Dynasty issued an "administrative order" requiring monks to stop drinking and eating. The need to be both vegetarian and satisfy one's cravings led later generations to use their brains and develop meat-like vegetarian food that can mimic meat. ;

;

;;Although the image in the video is humorous and friendly, Zhang Liangren waved his hands and laughed at himself, saying that he is an "old scholar" who spends all day burying his head in old papers and not listening to what is going on outside the window. He is good at academic research, digging soil, and giving lectures; reviewing video scripts and embedding historical knowledge can also be regarded as an extension of his professional skills. ;

;

;;Only appearing on camera is a big problem: "I am a person who is not good at words, and I cannot speak Mandarin well." In the first few videos, his eyes were habitually Avoid the camera and look away. ;

;

;;But what can stump a true "old scholar"? He began to use his scholarly spirit to make short videos, and specially hired an announcer to train himself to correct his pronunciation, improve his intonation and language rhythm, and practice facing the camera. Now, although he is still a little green and awkward, he can already look directly into the camera, clearly tell the history behind the food, and even make some funny expressions and movements to interact with the imaginary audience. ;

;

;;The contrast between "old scholar" and various current buzzwords, the fresh combination of historical knowledge and gourmet temptations, and the high-frequency output of updates every two days make the book more interesting. Zhang Liangren became a "top leader" in the archaeological community in just over two months. ;

;

;;But compared with the increased traffic figures, what makes him even more happy is that many ordinary people will leave messages or private messages asking questions related to archeology and history. "More people are interested in We are interested in archeology.";

;

;;Many young students also left messages: Can they take the postgraduate entrance examination for professors? Zhang Liangren will be more cautious towards this type of fans. On the one hand, he is pleased that more young people want to join the archaeological industry; on the other hand, he has to remind them that doing research and popular science are not the same thing. ;

;

;;

;

;;The history of fried dough sticks;

;

;;Zhang Liangren has long noticed , in recent years, with the broadcast of film and television programs such as "I Repair Cultural Relics in the Forbidden City" and "National Treasure", archeology has gradually entered the public eye. Many of his own students were influenced by these programs and decided to apply for the archeology major. The first lesson he taught these young students was to pour cold water on them: "Break their romantic imagination of archeology - TV programs present the most interesting and accomplished aspects of this subject, but behind the fun and achievements, It is extremely long and hard work. If you can’t stand the loneliness, don’t enter this industry.”;

;

;;In fact, it took Zhang Liangren himself many years to fall in love with archeology. ;

;

;;

;

;;Let more people understand archeology;

;

;;When I took the exam When he was in college, he had no idea what his interests were, so he muddleheadedly applied for the Department of Archeology. During his undergraduate and postgraduate years, Zhang Liangren spent his time attending classes, reading materials, and writing papers. It was difficult and boring, just like the public's stereotype of archeology. It wasn’t until I started to come into contact with a large number of historical materials from all over the world during my PhD studies and participated in field surveys and excavations around the world that I felt the joy of this subject. ;

;

;;The part that he enjoys the most is the most feared "digging" part of archeology: sleeping in the open air, exposed to the sun and rain, under the pressure of scholars Title, doing heavy physical work. ;

;

;;“I like this kind of life to explore in inaccessible places, bask in the sun, look at the scenery, and breathe fresh air.” Moreover, compared to sitting in the library and studying Archeology can always surprise him with the achievements of predecessors and the first-hand information that is freshly excavated and stained with real historical dust, inspiring him to discover new problems. "I am very excited and not boring at all.";

;

;;So, after using a basin of cold water to extinguish the romantic imagination of young people, he will use the true connotation of this subject to "warm" them back - after all, he has given This introductory course for freshmen is called "The Archeology of Charm." ;

;

;;;3. Curiosity is the answer;;;;

;

;;History The Xianlin campus where the department is located is 20 to 30 kilometers away from downtown Nanjing. After working here for nearly ten years, Zhang Liangren’s life trajectory has never exceeded five kilometers around the campus. He mainly eats in the school cafeteria, and goes out to hang out when friends come. A meal as a supplement. ;

;

;;But since he became a food blogger, he "goes to the city to eat delicious food" every day, and has even become a food trendsetter in Nanjing's archaeological circles. His colleagues always ask questions when they see him. One sentence: Which restaurant have you been to recently? He thought, how could he ignore so many delicious foods in Jinling, the capital of gourmet food? This kind of shop-hopping life seems to be pretty good. ;

;

;;This career, which was originally just a means of "saving the country through curves," now takes up a little more time every week than teaching. He has already begun to make long-term plans: after exploring Nanjing cuisine, he will also explore national cuisine, and then world cuisine; not only cooking food, but also introducing other archaeological related knowledge, such as the two issues of "Three Whitening Tips of the Ancients" and "A 400-degree myopic guide to traveling through ancient times." ;

;

;;

;

;;Zhang Liangren participated in excavations in Russia in 2019;

;

;;One The video shooting session, which initially made him feel uncomfortable, gradually became more comfortable. Only then did he realize that those food programs on TV were all "acted". What about "Journey to the West" "The flat peach eaten by Sun Wukong in "Water Margin" could not be a real flat peach, and the bowl of wine Wu Song drank before fighting the tiger in "Water Margin" could not be a real bar? ;

;;Originally, he wanted to "facilitate" archeology to the public. Unexpectedly, in the process, the daily life of the public unknowingly entered his pile of old papers, which made this old scholar Got caught up in the fireworks and became a "slash professor" at the age of 58. ;

;

;;Now he can answer the question: What is the connection between archeology and daily life? Zhang Liangren’s answer is: curiosity. ;

;;“People are curious and want to know where they come from and where they are going, so everyone likes to go to museums and see ruins and cultural relics. ;

;For the governance of online violence, what needs to be solved urgently is the problem of overly fragmented legislation. (Photo provided by People’s Vision)

;

;As of June 2023, the number of Internet users in China has reached 1.079 billion. A survey in early 2022 showed that 38.6% of people in China have suffered varying degrees of online violence on social media.

;

;"All cases of cyber violence have one thing in common, that is, they are violent and the consequences are tragic." On the morning of November 7, 2023, in the "Cyber ​​Violence Rule of Law" Liu Yanhong, dean of the School of Criminal Justice of China University of Political Science and Law, said at the seminar. On the forum, some scholars also expressed that they had suffered cyber violence and information intrusion.

;

;From "Dr. Deyang An committed suicide" and "Rumors were spread about a Hangzhou woman picking up express delivery" to Liu Xuezhou and Zheng Linghua died in unbearable cyber violence, vicious cyber violence incidents have occurred frequently in recent years. Various reports. “When cyber violence occurs, it stings the nerves of us legal professionals, because our first reaction is to quickly search for any provision in the criminal law that can convict people, but we are very surprised to find that the available provision is always So few." Liu Yanhong said.

;

;Many participating scholars believed that for the governance of cyber violence, what needs to be solved urgently is the problem of over-dispersed legislation, and anti-cyber violence legislation needs to be gradually promoted in a hierarchical manner.

;

;But on the other hand, some scholars have reminded that the essence of the governance of cyber violence is the governance of speech expression, and the difference between cyber violence and criticism needs to be carefully clarified. boundary.

;

;;“Not even the criminal law can catch up”;

;

;2013 On September 5, 2019, the Supreme People's Court, the Supreme People's Procuratorate and the Ministry of Public Security jointly issued the "Guiding Opinions on Punishing Illegal Crimes of Cyber ​​Violence in accordance with the Law", which classified cyber violence for the first time and explained the alleged crimes of different cyber violence behaviors.

;

;For example, if the perpetrator of cyber violence creates and spreads rumors on the Internet, derogating others' personality and damaging their reputation, and the circumstances are serious, they will be convicted of defamation; Those who publicly insult others by means of wanton abuse, malicious slander, disclosure of privacy, etc., and if the circumstances are serious, shall be convicted of the crime of insult; organize "human flesh searches" to illegally collect and release citizens' personal information to an unspecified majority of people, and if the circumstances are serious, they shall be convicted of the crime of infringement. Conviction of citizens’ personal information crimes.

;

;Liu Yanhong believes that the current judicial interpretation has a narrow definition of cyber violence and pays less attention to cyber intimidation, stalking and bullying. On the other hand, as to whether human flesh search constitutes the crime of infringing on citizens’ personal information, “it needs to reach a certain number and change from quantitative to qualitative changes to constitute a crime. Therefore, it is difficult to determine that a general manual search conducted by multiple people infringes on personal information of citizens. Information crime”.

;

;"Even the criminal law is unable to catch up." Liu Yanhong said that in the field of civil adjudication and administrative law enforcement in the field of online violence, this kind of "law does not punish the public" "The tendency remains.

;

;In terms of procedures, there is a lack of unified norms and standards for evidence collection in cyber violence cases. Yin Bo, a professor at the School of Criminal Justice of China University of Political Science and Law, mentioned that in private prosecution cases of cyber violence Among them, the party’s ability to produce evidence is relatively weak. In order to break down technical barriers, evidence is usually extracted by internal or external professionals under the auspices of the public security or other judicial organs. However, the existing electronic evidence production still lacks technology and methods. " Even the grassroots public security organs do not know how to collect evidence, dare not collect evidence, and cannot collect evidence."

;

;On August 3, 2023, the Beijing Internet Court released a number of typical cases involving online violence.

;

;Liu is a "big V" blogger with nearly 500,000 Weibo fans. Another Weibo user, Sun, was involved in a dispute over a current affairs issue. Liu had a different view and sent insulting words to Liu through Weibo private messages. Liu posted Sun's private messages, Weibo account, photos and other information on Weibo, along with insulting remarks, triggering online violence against Sun from netizens. In the end, the court ruled that Liu had infringed the law and deleted the Weibo and comments involved in the case that infringed on Sun's portrait and reputation. Both parties apologized to each other in writing, and the amount of mental damage compensation was offset by each other.

;

;Liu Yanhong previously wrote that netizens who posted negative comments to insult Sun could have been held liable for civil infringement and administrative liability for disrupting online order, but in the judicial process In law enforcement practice, such acts committed by non-initiators and non-organizers are generally ignored.

;

;On the other hand, for the current governance of cyber violence, there are relevant provisions in the Civil Code, Criminal Law, Administrative Penalty Law and other laws and regulations that can be used, but different laws Each has its own value orientation.

;

;"Generally speaking, the current legislation on the governance of cyber violence is like a flood in Kowloon." She advocates comprehensive and progressive legislation, such as being first formulated by the State Council. Regulations on the Prevention and Control of Cyber ​​Violence, followed by legislation on the prevention and control of cyber violence, and finally the establishment of an organic law for cyber violence governance agencies, and finally the unified rise to the Anti-Cyber ​​Violence Law.

;

;Wang Sixin, deputy director of the Research Institute of a Community with a Shared Future for Mankind at Communication University of China, also said that step-by-step legislation is more likely to achieve practical results.

;

;;To prevent platform abuse of power;

;

;At the seminar, Some scholars also warned that we should be cautious about anti-cyber violence legislation.

;

;"The governance of online violence is essentially the governance of speech." Zhi Zhenfeng, a researcher at the Institute of Law, Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, said that for normal criticism and Supervision and discussion of different opinions should be protected. "Online violence must be controlled, but everyone's rights to speech and expression must also be protected."

;

;As to how to distinguish normal online criticism from illegal online violence, Shi Jiayou, a professor at Renmin University of China, said that subjectively speaking, online criticism is generally well-intentioned and its purpose is Often it is about safeguarding public interests or one's own legitimate rights and interests. From an objective point of view, Internet criticism is generally based on basic facts. The facts criticized are generally well-founded or have reasonable information channels, and are not groundless or randomly fabricated; even if the facts confirmed in the end are different from the initial There are discrepancies or partial inaccuracies in the critical remarks, but as long as the critical remarks do have an objective basis as a whole and the critic has reasonable grounds to believe in the authenticity of the facts cited, then the critical remarks should be considered to be a reasonable exercise of freedom of speech. scope.

;

;Therefore, Zhi Zhenfeng emphasized that the focus of combating cyber violence should be organized manipulation of public opinion. “For example, behind cyber thugs and cyber trolls, there are often Organized ones, where one organization can control dozens or millions of accounts at the same time, as well as overseas account matrices involving national security, are all targets that should be targeted."

;

;In addition, he believes that as a platform that builds a public opinion space, it has an obligation to maintain the order of the public opinion space. "The platform has technical strength and can intervene through front-end and make samples." Use database modeling and other technologies to control cyber violence."

;

;Professor Wang Limei from the Data Law Institute of China University of Political Science and Law added this. She believes that platforms should first improve the real-name system, which can be based on the different natures of the platform and spokespersons. , implement front-end or back-end real-name. Secondly, platforms should set up preventive technical measures so that those who are cyberviolated can trigger the protection mechanism with “one click”.

;October 28, 2023, Qingshui River, Myanmar, Myanmar October 28, 2023 On the Qingshui River in Myanmar, members of the Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army took a group photo with members of the Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army on Qianshao Mountain and weapons seized from the Myanmar army on Qianshao Mountain ; (Visual China/ Picture);

;

;On October 27, 2023, Myanmar’s ethnic local armed forces headed by the Kokang National Democratic Alliance Army launched a military operation called “1027 Joint Operation” to cooperate with the Myanmar military in Fierce fighting broke out in Lashio, Guidai and other places in northern Myanmar. A few days ago, Myanmar military government spokesman Zaw Min Tun has admitted that the Qingshui River in the China-Myanmar border area has been occupied by the Allied Forces.

;

;Fighting in northern Shan State has intensified since the alliance announced a full-scale offensive on the Kokang region, with an ethnic minority alliance claiming to have captured four towns and dozens of military posts, blocking access to China. trade routes. And continue to destroy roads, communication facilities and bridges used by government forces to support the Shan State front line. This has forced the Myanmar military to rely on air transportation to support Lao Cai, the capital of Kokang, including using helicopters to transport supplies, pick up the wounded and family members of senior officials, and even airdrop special operations personnel to strengthen defenses.

;

;This can be said to be the biggest military challenge faced by Myanmar's military government since Aung San Suu Kyi was captured by the army in 2021. As we all know, during the Spring Festival in 2015, the Kokang Allied Forces launched a military operation in an attempt to counterattack the Kokang Autonomous Region, which they had lost since 2009. However, the operation failed due to the full stranglehold of the Burmese army, and they were forced to evacuate the Kokang area and continued to attack along the Salween River. Fighting in the Hongyan guerrilla zone. At present, it seems that the intensity and progress of the Kokang Allied Forces' attack on Kokang this time are significantly greater than those in 2015. Therefore, many people are puzzled by the increased strength of the Allied Forces. Various conspiracy theories have even arisen around this question.

;

;Why does the Kokang Allied Forces seem to have increased in strength, and why is this offensive so powerful?

;

;In fact, the Kokang Allied Forces did not suddenly become stronger. In the attack on Lao Cai in 2015, the three main brigades of the Allied Forces performed quite well. Not only does it have very strong mobile warfare capabilities, but it is also quite skilled in long-range sniping. Such combat effectiveness is inseparable from the long-term mountain guerrilla warfare after the Allied Forces were reestablished in 2010.

;

;Of course, no matter how strong the combat effectiveness is, the army also needs a sufficient economic base to support it. The outside world knows very little about the financial resources of the Kokang Allied Forces.

;

;There are rumors on the Internet that the Kokang Allied Forces have been fighting guerrillas in the virgin forest since 2009. In fact, it still maintains a relatively fixed base area, namely the famous Hongyan District, located in the eastern part of the Red Star District of the Kokang Special Administrative Region. Adjacent to the China-Myanmar border, the Nu River and Baihu Mountain cover an area of ​​approximately 36 square kilometers. In addition to the base areas within Kokang territory, the Kokang Allied Forces also have other footholds. The Fourth Special Administrative Region in eastern Shan State has allowed the alliance leadership and some troops to enter since 2009. The current government chairman of the Fourth Special Administrative Region, Lin Mingxian, is the son-in-law of Peng Jiasheng, the founder of the Kokang Alliance Army.

;

;In the areas controlled by the Kokang Allied Forces, they can raise funds through taxation and border trade. In addition, the Kokang Allied Forces also control some docks in the Salween River and Mekong River basins, which can be used for material transfer and to collect tolls.

;

;In addition, after the Kokang conflict in 2015, because the Kokang Alliance Army showed quite good combat effectiveness in the conflict, it was regarded as a backer by other surrounding ethnic and local armed forces. These ethnic and local armed forces began to support the Kokang Alliance. The military directly provides economic support and logistical supplies. The Kokang Alliance Army, the Arakan Army, and the Ta'ang Liberation Army further formed the famous Three Brothers Alliance (3BHA) in 2017. Subsequently, they often cooperated with each other to fight, and they also shared their financial and logistical needs.

;

;Both Rakhine and De'ang have their own stable and controlled base areas, and the base areas have the economic foundation of primary and secondary industries such as jade and jade, minerals, mahogany, tea, agricultural products, sugar cane and sugar, and also have Border trade, specialty tourism and other tertiary industries, so the economic situation is naturally much better than that of the Kokang Allied Forces with a small base area. Their support for the Kokang Alliance undoubtedly strengthened the entire alliance in general.

;

;In addition to the Three Brothers Alliance, the United Wa State Army and the Kachin Independence Army, as the two largest ethnic local armed forces in northern Myanmar, also have considerable support for the Three Brothers Alliance. The local armed forces have certain military manufacturing capabilities and can produce light weapons, ammunition and even light artillery on their own. Many of the logistical equipment of the local armed factions of various ethnic groups in northern Myanmar rely on the support of the Kachin and Wa States. The late founder of the Kokang Alliance Army, Peng Jiasheng, also had good personal relationships with leaders of the Kachin and Wa states.

;

;In fact, there is a core demand behind the support of the Kokang Alliance Army by ethnic and local armed forces in the region, that is, they hope that the Kokang Alliance Army can bear more pressure when the Myanmar government forces attack. After all, the other forces have stable bases and ethnic populations. Fighting with the government forces is not conducive to the development of local people's livelihood. The Kokang Allied Forces have lost their "hometown" and have a small remaining territory. They also want to "fight back home", so they are obviously more willing to spare their efforts. For the Kokang Allied Forces, even if they lose the Hongyan base, the worst they can do is continue to fight guerrillas in the guerrilla zone.

;

;Judging from the news footage of this "Operation 1027", the Kokang Allied Forces have not significantly improved their equipment. Although some weapons have been updated, they are still various light weapons common in northern Myanmar. As for combat equipment, helmets and new military uniforms, they are also low-end private products that can be bought everywhere. In terms of personnel recruitment, in recent years due to the internal divisions of the Bamar ethnic group, the Kokang Allied Forces have also begun to recruit non-Kokang soldiers. For example, the 611 Brigade established in 2022, most of the members are non-Kokang.

;

;The biggest upgrade in weapons and equipment of the Kokang Alliance this time is actually the drone, but it is also a common commercial model. In recent years, anti-government forces have begun to use drones extensively in Myanmar's civil war, especially after the military government captured Aung San Suu Kyi. The People's Defense Force (PDF) formed by Aung San's supporters has quite a bit of knowledge from Myanmar universities. Molecules and technologists who are able to build their own drones by purchasing parts. These also include fixed-wing drones with corrugated skins, which are almost invisible to radar because they have very few metal parts. The local ethnic armed forces in northern Myanmar also often use this kind of drone as a patrol missile, and it is said that the actual combat effect is good.

;

;After 2015, the Kokang Alliance Army assumed a role similar to that of the vanguard army and training team of ethnic local armed forces in the region. Through continuous actual combat, it opened up the situation on the one hand and helped train personnel of other friendly neighboring forces on the other. , so the combat effectiveness has been very stable. In March 2017, the Kokang Allied Forces attacked the Lao Cai Casino, causing more than 30 casualties and sweeping away the casino's treasury. After exchanging fire with the Myanmar government troops and pro-government local armed forces who came to support, they escaped unscathed. Therefore, before the conflict broke out on October 27, 2023, the Kokang Allied Forces were likely to have the strength to directly attack Lao Cai, and what they were waiting for might be a suitable opportunity.
